soc.message
Class GameOptionInfo

java.lang.Object
  soc.message.Message
      soc.message.MessageMulti
          soc.message.MessageTemplateMs
              soc.message.GameOptionInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class GameOptionInfo
extends MessageTemplateMs

Information on one available game option. Reply from server to a client's GAMEOPTIONGETINFOS message. Provides the option's information, including default value, and current value at the server for new games. If the server doesn't know this option, the returned option type is GameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN. If the client asks about an option too new for it to use, the server will respond with GameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN.

Special case: If the client is asking for any new options, by sending GAMEOPTIONGETINFOS("-"), but there aren't any new options, server responds with OPTINFO_NO_MORE_OPTS, a GAMEOPTIONINFO named "-" with type OTYPE_UNKNOWN.

This is so clients can find out about options which were introduced in versions newer than the client's version, but which may be applicable to their version or all versions.

Introduced in 1.1.07; check client version against NewGameWithOptions.VERSION_FOR_NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS before sending this message.

Robot clients don't need to know about or handle this message type, because they don't create or browse games.

Since:
1.1.07
Author:
Jeremy D Monin
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

OPTINFO_NO_MORE_OPTS

public static final GameOptionInfo OPTINFO_NO_MORE_OPTS
If the client is asking for any new options, by sending GAMEOPTIONGETINFOS("-"), server responds with set of GAMEOPTIONINFOs. Mark end of this list with a GAMEOPTIONINFO named "-" with type OTYPE_UNKNOWN.

Method Detail

getMinimumVersion

public int getMinimumVersion()
Minimum version where this message type is used. GAMEOPTIONINFO introduced in 1.1.07 for game-options feature.

Overrides:
getMinimumVersion in class Message
Returns:
Version number, 1107 for JSettlers 1.1.07.

getOptionNameKey

public java.lang.String getOptionNameKey()
Returns:
the name (key) of the option, or "-" for the end-of-list marker.

getOptionInfo

public GameOption getOptionInfo()
Returns:
the parsed option values, or null if this message is coming from a client asking about a game

parseDataStr

public static GameOptionInfo parseDataStr(java.lang.String[] pa)
Parse the command String array into a GameOptionInfo message. 
 pa[0] = key (name of the option)
 pa[1] = type
 pa[2] = minVersion
 pa[3] = lastModVersion
 pa[4] = defaultBoolValue ('t' or 'f')
 pa[5] = defaultIntValue
 pa[6] = minIntValue
 pa[7] = maxIntValue
 pa[8] = boolValue ('t' or 'f'; current, not default)
 pa[9] = intValue (current, not default) or stringvalue
 pa[10] = dropIfUnused ('t' or 'f')
 pa[11] = optDesc (displayed text) if present; required for all but OTYPE_UNKNOWN
 pa[12] and beyond, if present = each enum choice's text

Parameters:
pa - the String parameters
Returns:
a GameOptionInfo message, or null if parsing errors
